div.p: This element belongs conceptually to WRITING PRODUCTION . It enables searches on place of publication. The tag encloses a full sentence, not just the place, which however you will need to tag with appropriate PLACE tags.

Orlando convention is that London, UK, is too much the centre of British publishing to need tagging unless for a particular reason; so are New York or Toronto for contemporary non-British texts. But we tag other places if mentioned in prose of entry: this enables users to see other or shifting centres, esp. any centres for publishing women, or places used for false imprints to avoid censorship.

div.codeblock: <PPLACEOFPUBLICATION>Most of her poems were published in <PLACE><SETTLEMENT>Leicester</SETTLEMENT><REGION REG=”Leicestershire”></REGION><GEOG REG=”England”></GEOG></PLACE> before they appeared in <PLACE><SETTLEMENTLondon</SETTLEMENT><REGION REG=”Middlesex”><GEOG REG=”England”></GEOG></REGION></PLACE></PPLACEOFPUBLICATION>
